poem:
**Unit**

In sterile halls, the echoes 
whisper 
shrunken secrets—  
voices warring 
with tissue-thin hope.

Nurses 
in white armor 
speak in softened commands:  
Eat, just eat—

Beyond these walls, the world
sails on—
unaware, untouched.

Here, in this shrunken space,
life  
hangs by the thread  
of a single bite.
